bibl.title: Letter from Melvin D. Brewer to Philip Showalter Hench, December 13, 1940

div1.p: Brewer promises to send Hench photographs taken at the Lazear memorial event. He claims that he never received the autographed photographs of Moran and Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Melvin D. Brewer to Philip Showalter Hench, December 13, 1940
div1.opener:
Greetings From Washington and Jefferson College
December 13, 1940
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Under separate cover I am sending you 45
pictures of different scenes taken on Founders'
Day. These pictures were made by the D. A. Har-
baugh Studio in Washington.

Since this is the last of the pictures that
we will have, I filled out the check which you
sent me in October to the amount of $27.50. This
will pay for the pictures which I got for you some
time ago from Mr. Arnold, as well as for the pic-
tures I am sending today. Arnold's pictures cost
$18.50 and Harbaugh's bill was $9.00, making a
total of $27.50.

We are still at a loss about the pictures
of Moran and Kissinger. Since we have been unable
to find them anywhere in our files, we have mailed
pictures to Mr. Moran and Mr. Kissinger and have
asked them to autograph one for you. When writing
to them, we assumed responsibility for the loss of
the first pictures so that they may be sure that
they were not lost due to any negligence on your
part.

I distinctly remember saying to Miss Hough
when your pictures arrived that we did not need
the pictures of Moran and Kissinger. I had already
received pictures from each of the men. I pointed
out to her the paragraph in your letter stating
that the autographed pictures were enclosed but
that I had not found them in the package when it
came. When the pictures arrived, I looked them
Page 2.
over in Dr. Hutchison's office. I remember sitting on
the edge of Miss Hough's desk and selecting the pictures
I wanted for the dinner program. The only pictures I
had then were the ones published in the dinner program.

I hope that Mr. Moran and Mr. Kissinger will get
their autographed pictures to you very soon.

As you may know, much of the delay in these mat-
ters on my part has been due to my absence from the
office and my marriage, which is enough to keep a fel-
low in an uproar for a couple of weeks.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Melvin D. Brewer
Alumni Secretary Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
